parse.title: List of National Waterways in India

text.*:
India Map

There are 111 officially notified Inland National Waterways (NWs) in India identified for the purposes of inland water transport,[1] as per The National Waterways Act, 2016. Out of the 111 NWs, 106 were created in 2016. The NW network covers around 20,275.5 km. NW-1, 2, & 3 are already operational. Cargo as well as passenger / cruise vessels are plying on these waterways. Detailed Project Report(DPR) for development of NW-4 & 5 was completed in 2010. The DPR of NW 5 was updated in 2014. For the newly declared 106 NWs, techno-economic feasibility studies have been initiated.[2]

NW110 Yamuna River Haryana, UP & Delhi 1089 P Wazirabad barrage (north Delhi)-Palla (north Faridabad) perennial section is being developed for the passenger and cargo ferry service.[3]
Okhla barrage-Agra steamer service is planned by the end of June 2017 with the help of Netherlands (c. Feb 2017).[4]
NW111 Zuari River Goa 50 N
